answer:
Formaldehyde is used in vaccines to inactivate viruses and protein toxins. You will find a list of vaccines that are used in Canada and their ingredients here. If you have questions, please contact your immunization provider for further information.
Immunization Nurse
question: I have a been sensitized to formaldehyde (Gross Anatomy, Dental college, 2001). Further exposure during school & private practice led to increased respiratory reactions. I was told I could not get the flu vaccine. Does this apply to other vaccines?
